node.title: Husband of slain cinematographer 'so angry' Baldwin took no blame
node.description: The husband of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins has said he was "so angry" that actor Alec Baldwin denied responsibility for her death after Baldwin shot her during the filming of the Western Rust.

node.title: Ukraine computers hit by data-wiping software as fears of full-scale Russian invasion rise
node.description: A newly discovered piece of destructive software found circulating in Ukraine has hit hundreds of computers, according to researchers at a cybersecurity firm.

node.title: Aotea helipad planning puts archaeological sites at risk - Heritage NZ
node.description: Heritage New Zealand wants helipad planners to consider the wealth of archaeological sites on Aotea Great Barrier Island.

node.title: GPs, pharmacists brace for huge demand for RATs in phase three
node.description: GPs and pharmacists are bracing for huge demand for rapid antigen tests (RATs) as the country prepares to go into phase three. Audio

node.title: Labour Party donations case: Suppression lapses for three defendants
node.description: Three of the people accused of electoral fraud in relation to the Labour Party are also defending charges in relation to the National Party.

node.title: Stock markets reel, oil surges after Russia attacks Ukraine
node.description: U.S. stock futures sold off and oil prices topped $100 a barrel for the first time since 2014 as investors sought refuge.

node.title: Covid-19 Omicron outbreak: New Zealand to move to phase 3 of response
node.description: New Zealand will move to phase 3 of the Omicron response at 11.59pm, Covid-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins has confirmed.

node.title: Buller faces long list of urgent repairs in flooding aftermath
node.description: Extreme rainfall and flooding has left roading and infrastructure across the Buller District in a fragile state and in urgent need of repair before further heavy rain hits the region.

node.title: Covid-19: 6137 new community cases in NZ today, one further death
node.description: The daily number of community cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand has soared past the 6000 mark, with a record 6137 new cases today - almost double yesterday's numbers.

node.title: Covid anger at the supermarket: 'Every single day still'
node.description: People are taking their Covid-related anger out on Countdown supermarket staff, says corporate affairs manager Kiri Hannafin. Audio

node.title: ANZ raises some deposit and lending interest rates
node.description: The country's biggest bank is raising some deposit and lending interest rates in response to the Reserve Bank's increase in the cash rate.

node.title: Dame Lisa Carrington chasing more gold
node.description: Dame Lisa Carrington isn't easing off as she heads into another busy year on the water.

node.title: Sport NZ to address declining numbers of teenage girls in sport
node.description: Sport New Zealand wants to combat the steep drop-off in girls participation in sport and active recreation with a campaign focused on helping young women feel confident, be part of the conversation…

node.title: Hundreds more schools and centres dealing with Covid-19 cases
node.description: The Education Ministry says 717 schools and early learning centres are managing Covid-19 cases, up from 447 on Monday.

node.title: Chief ombudsman launches investigation into NZDF
node.description: The investigation follows a complaint by journalist Nicky Hager, who alleges the NZDF withheld crucial information from the Ombudsman during an inquiry into civilian deaths in Afghanistan.

node.title: NATO officials say Russian attack of Ukraine has begun
node.description: The attack began moments after Russian President Vladimir Putin announced he had "decided to conduct a special military operation."

node.title: Ukraine: UN chief warns no one can 'sit out this crisis'
node.description: Ukraine has appealed to the UN General Assembly to stop Russia's "aggressive plans," as UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres warned an expanded conflict "could see a scale and severity of need unseen…

node.title: Lockdowns partly to blame for Air NZ's $272m half-year loss
node.description: Air New Zealand has reported another big loss as the pandemic continues to wreck havoc on its operations.

node.title: Ukraine's leader warns Russia: We will defend ourselves
node.description: In a national address, Ukraine's president says his attempts to speak to Vladimir Putin were rejected.

node.title: Government terminates agreement relating to Whakaari/ White island
node.description: The government has ditched a Whakaari/ White Island Memorandum of Understanding.

node.title: Funding boost to help control deer and other pests at two major forest parks
node.description: The new spending will help with the management of deer and other predators at the Kaimanawa and Kaweka Forest Parks.

node.title: Waimea Dam project goes $80m over initial cost
node.description: In 2020, the Waimea Dam project cost jumped from $104.4m to $129.4m, and its mid-year report for the 2022 financial year puts the cost at $185m.

node.title: New Zealand’s response to Russia – sanctions or diplomacy?
node.description: Analysis - International analyst Geoffrey Miller considers options for New Zealand's response to Russia's incursion into Ukraine.

node.title: Terrorist's lawyer intends seeking a judicial review of Royal Commission's findings
node.description: The lawyer for the terrorist who murdered 51 people in the Christchurch mosque attacks says he intends to seek a judicial review of the Royal Commission.

node.title: Govt to fund rural broadband network upgrades
node.description: The government has committed to bettering broadband network connectivity in rural areas.

node.title: Forestry rule changes for overseas investors planning to convert farmland
node.description: The government is planning to change rules which help foreign investors purchase farmland in New Zealand for forestry conversions.

node.title: ACT calls for end to mandates, contact tracing, QR codes
node.description: Party Leader David Seymour has called for a cost-benefit analysis of Covid-19 interventions, saying the current settings are a "mish-mash of rules that don't make sense".

node.title: Police name man shot dead in Nelson
node.description: Police have named the man whose death is the subject of a homicide inquiry in Nelson.

node.title: Ivanka Trump in talks to appear before Jan. 6 committee, spokesperson says
node.description: Last month, the committee tasked with investigating the January 6 attack asked Trump's daughter and former adviser to voluntarily speak with them.

node.title: Ukraine says one soldier killed, 6 wounded in separatist shelling
node.description: The Ukrainian military said on Wednesday one soldier had been killed and six wounded in shelling by pro-Russian separatists in east Ukraine in the past 24 hours as ceasefire violations remain at a…
